svg.text: ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ DESIRABLE METRIC PROPERTIES │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ │ │ SENSITIVITY │ │ └─▶ Metric should detect changes in user experience │ │ └─▶ Lower variance = higher sensitivity │ │ └─▶ Test: Does metric move when product changes? │ │ │ │ DIRECTIONALITY │ │ └─▶ Clear which direction is andquot;goodandquot; │ │ └─▶ Avoid metrics where up or down could be good │ │ └─▶ Example: Time on site (good?) vs Task completion │ │ │ │ ATTRIBUTABILITY │ │ └─▶ Can attribute change to treatment │ │ └─▶ Minimize external confounds │ │ └─▶ Triggered analysis helps │ │ │ │ STABILITY │ │ └─▶ Not overly affected by outliers │ │ └─▶ Consistent over time (low day-to-day variance) │ │ └─▶ Consider winsorization for heavy-tailed metrics │ │ │ │ INTERPRETABILITY │ │ └─▶ Stakeholders understand what it means │ │ └─▶ Can translate to business impact │ │ └─▶ Actionable insights possible │ │ │ │ TIMELINESS │ │ └─▶ Observable within reasonable timeframe │ │ └─▶ Consider proxy metrics for long-term outcomes │ │ │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
